proposedChanges.value: In hero section, below main headline, display a 3-icon grid with short labels for 'Delegate Tasks', 'Maintain Control', and 'Predictable Cost'.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visually grounds the core value proposition immediately, reinforcing key differentiators (delegation, control) and addressing price transparency.
risks: May clutter the hero if icons are poorly designed.

proposedChanges.value: Directly below the hero, add a 2-column section with a headline about 'control' and 3 bullet points on dashboards, approvals, and reporting.
proposedChanges.rationale: Proactively addresses the primary 'loss of control' objection immediately after the value prop, building trust early in the user journey.
risks: Could slow the user's scroll path to pricing.

proposedChanges.value: Add a 'proof bar' with 5-6 client logos placed directly above the fold on the homepage, between the navigation and the hero headline.
proposedChanges.rationale: Establishes immediate credibility and social proof the instant a user lands on the page, before they even process the main headline.
risks: Requires recognizable client logos to be maximally effective.

proposedChanges.value: On the pricing page, replace any existing list with a full 3-column comparison table that includes a 'show all features' toggle.
proposedChanges.rationale: Enables direct, side-by-side comparison of tiers, while a toggle prevents overwhelming users with an exhaustive feature list by default.
risks: Can be challenging to display effectively on mobile screens.

proposedChanges.value: Below the pricing table, add a 3-item FAQ accordion specifically addressing 'Why this price?', 'What if I need more?', and 'Are there hidden fees?'.
proposedChanges.rationale: Handles the 'too expensive' objection by framing it around value and transparency, preventing users from bouncing due to price shock.
risks: May draw unnecessary attention to price sensitivity.

proposedChanges.value: On the pricing page, create a 2-column 'Included / Not Included' checklist below the comparison table to define service boundaries.
proposedChanges.rationale: Explicitly clarifies what the service does and does not cover, addressing the 'what's included' objection and managing expectations.
risks: Highlighting 'Not Included' items could create negative focus.

proposedChanges.value: In each of the 3 pricing tier cards, add a 'Best for:' label (e.g., 'Best for Founders', 'Best for Growing Teams') to help users self-segment.
proposedChanges.rationale: Guides users to the most appropriate plan, clarifying the intended value for different customer profiles and reducing decision fatigue.
risks: Users may feel incorrectly categorized or pigeonholed.

proposedChanges.value: In the footer of the Homepage, Pricing, and FAQ pages, add a single-line tagline: 'LaunchBase: Your business's operating system.'
proposedChanges.rationale: Reinforces the core 'operating system' positioning consistently across every key page, improving brand message recall and alignment.
risks: Could become repetitive if not implemented subtly.
Implementing all structural changes simultaneously may disrupt established user behavior.
Changes are structural; success is still dependent on the quality of the final copy.
assumptions: The business has at least 3 distinct pricing tiers.
The business has client logos available for use.
